ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] From a magician list. A little more info
ygData.msgSnippet: Hola gnomes of Norrath, tis I Calador again.  I appologize for my absence, it took me a while to track down Ursoo again, he has been very elusive, probably due
ygData.messageBody:
Hola gnomes of Norrath, tis I Calador again.  I appologize for my absence, it took me a while to track down Ursoo again, he has been very elusive, probably due in part to the fact that I haven't been on as much lately because of work.  Anyway this weekend, I caught him online, and got the real names of the parts he found, and got him to agree to bring them to me so I could have a tinkering friend of mine try his hand at this recipe.  Xeus was right about the gear thing, Ursoo aparently just looked at them and assumed they were simply gears, in reality, they are Size 6 sprockets.  Let me reiterate the parts we have:
 
Inferno Shock (Wizzie Spell)
Metal Twine
Metal Rod
Gizmo #6  (may need to be replaced by a gizmo #4)
Large Lantern
 
(things get a bit strange on the rest)
 
(13 X) Size 6 sprockets
(5 X)   Metal Bits  (used in smithing)
(4 X)   Ambers
 
Yes, the last 3 parts used multiples, and were stacked, which is the only way they would all fit in a toolbox anyway.   This recipe could be tried with only 1 of each of the last 3 now that we know it uses sprockets and not just gears, but I figure knowing the way the rest of tinkering works, that the multiples would be right, to drive prices up for making these.  I intend to get back to Ak'Anon, and find a friendly gnome to help me test this, and the optional recipe using a Gizmo # 4, but I am in Eastern Karana now, and do not know when my travels may take me back that way.  I hope this is a viable recipe, and will create something, anything, maybe even something that will help fill the skill gap between aqualungs, and rebreathers.  Again, I appologize for not getting this information to you sooner.   Good Luck.
 
Calador Stormblood.
Ranger of the 24th Season.
Tarew Marr.
-----Original Message-----
From: Xeus Revenger [mailto:x_revenger@...]
Sent: Friday, April 28, 2000 11:07 AM
To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] From a magician list. A little more info

Hey fellow gnomes,

  i think we need to get Ursoo to say EXACTLY what he
found- i mean, for examples:

1. Gears- could be anything that looked like a
gear(maybe he saw it and just said what it looked
like?)
2. large lantern- coule be a large lantern or a
flameless lantern(more likely)
3. metal parts- could be any number of things..ick

So, whoever knows Ursoo do ask him and find out if
this works on tarew marr, if it is really only active
on the server it was presented..
if this could happen it would rock-

-Xeus Telestubby
Lanys T'vyl 30th Wizard
Leader of <Revengers>

--- Jeremy Wells <jjdlc@...> wrote:
> Hi all,  Calador here again, I also reviewed a log
> file from the event, and
> me and Jorus just discussed it, and the person who
> mentioned the firewater
> was not one of the gnome participants, as the log
> was recording their last
> names, but did not record this persons.  I tell you,
> there can be some real
> jerks at these events, which makes it hard to sift
> through everything.  I
> just wanted to tell you all for sure, that no
> firewater was involved.  The
> log does not record loot messages, so I'll have to
> check with Ursoo tonight
> to find out the exact name of the "Metal Parts" he
> said he took.  Again,
> I'll let you know what I find out.
>     -----Original Message-----
>     From: Cory Burns [mailto:coryb@...]
>     Sent: Thursday, April 20, 2000 1:58 PM
>     To: EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com
>     Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] From a magician list. A
> little more info
>
>
>     I don't know if anyone has replied to my first

>     mail has been sitting in it's queue for about 5
> hours.  Hmm.  Well
>     anyways, I was running through the log files for
> the quest and one of
>     the gnomes also mentions needing firewater.  I
> overlooked it the
>     first time because of the 80 other people there
> 'saying' messages
>     constantly.  But, we did not see any firewater
> on the actual corpse
>     of the Personal Heater.
>
>     Jorus Ter'Xion
>     Tarew Marr
>
>
>
>
>     "Fanrick Tinker/Mage Tarew Marr
